title: Sample suspension template schema
description: Sample suspension template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

propertyDescriptions.suspension_entity_number: total number of cell/nuclei yielded post dissociation and enrichement
propertyDescriptions.sample_id: The unique Submission ID for the sample assigned by the ingest portal. An example value might be "VAN0010-LK-152-162".
propertyDescriptions.source_storage_time_value: The amount of time that elapsed between when the source was generated and this sample was derived from the source. This would, for example, include how long the source was stored in a freezer.
propertyDescriptions.preparation_temperature: the temperature for the preparation process
propertyDescriptions.processing_time_value: The amount of time that elapsed from beginning of sampling to the first preservation (time from when received in lab to preservation). This would, for example, represent how long it took to cut the tissue and freeze it.
propertyDescriptions.storage_temperature: The temperature during storage, after preparation and before the assay is performed.
propertyDescriptions.suspension_entity: the type of single cell entity derived from isolation protocol
propertyDescriptions.suspension_enriched_target: If the suspension was enriched, then this is the target of the enrichment
propertyDescriptions.quality_criteria: For example, RIN: 8.7. For suspensions, measured by visual inspection prior to cell lysis or defined by known parameters such as wells with several cells or no cells. This can be captured at a high level. "OK" or "not OK", or with more specificity such as "debris", "clump", "low clump".
propertyDescriptions.preparation_medium: The medium used during preparation of the sample.
propertyDescriptions.storage_medium: what was the sample preserved in
